etymology.description: 游 (move in water; roam) + 泳 (swim) = swim/swimming.
etymology.interpretation: Combines two near-synonymous morphemes to denote the act or sport of swimming. Used as both a verb and a noun in modern Chinese.

parts.english: to swim; to travel; to roam; to play/wander

examples.chinese: 他每天早上去游泳(他每天早上去游泳)。
夏天在海里游泳很舒服(夏天在海裡游泳很舒服)。
examples.pinyin: Xiàtiān zài hǎilǐ yóuyǒng hěn shūfu.
examples.english: Swimming in the sea in summer feels very comfortable.

examples.chinese: 游泳是一项很好的全身运动(游泳是一項很好的全身運動)。
examples.pinyin: Yóuyǒng shì yī xiàng hěn hǎo de quánshēn yùndòng.
examples.english: Swimming is an excellent full-body exercise.
